content.raw:
this is pretty subtle, kind of a hack. `directory_iterator` returns an iterator over the contents of a directory. So if the tested directory has restricted access, you will be able to read information about the directory without throwing an exception, but if you try to access its contents, it will throw an error. This is why `_path.status()` doesn't work if the directory is restricted, but `directory_iterator` does. Actually, the `iter->status()` line isn't needed at all.

Perhaps I should add a comment.
